text:
Where to Celebrate Mardi Gras and Fat Tuesday in Austin Laissez les bons temps rouler Stuffed Cajun Meat Market/Facebook 
Mardi Gras and Fat Tuesday are coming up near the end of the month, celebrating America’s finest excuse for weekday drinking, and eating tons of cake and crawfish . Grab that king cake , and hit up these restaurant and bar events brimming with New Orleans cocktails and food. 
Everything below takes place on Tuesday, February 28 , otherwise noted. This guide will be updated throughout the month. If there's a Mardi Gras celebration missing below, let Eater know through the comments or the tipline . 
Whisler’s The East 6th Street bar's annual Fat Tuesday celebration comes loaded with New Orleans-inspired cocktails, king cake from Haydel's Bakery in New Orleans, a brass band, and party favors. When: 4 p.m. Where: 1816 East 6th Street 
Drink.Well The party will be on with New Orleans-inspired cocktails (think Sazeracs, Grasshoppers, and Hurricanes). and other New Orleans drinks, alongside dishes like gumbo and fried oysters. The person who finds the baby in Drink.Well's twist on the sweet du jour, the king cake Twinkie , will receive something special. When: TBD Where : 207 East 53rd Street, North Loop 
Capital City Bakery Capital City Bakery is whipping up vegan beignets just for Fat Tuesday. It'll cost $7 for two of the pastries, alongside other delicacies and iced coffee. When: 4 to 7 p.m. Where: 2211 East Cesar Chavez Street 
BBQ Revolution It’s another vegan Fat Tuesday party at the smokey trailer. The menu will include Cajun vegan barbecue, cole slaw, bourbon sauce, and jambalaya. When: 7 to 10 p.m. Where: 2421 Webberville Road, East Side 
Haymaker Embracing the full spirit of the day, Haymaker is offering up green, yellow, and purple dollar Jello shots, frozen Hurricanes, Abita beer, and special New Orleans-insired food, along with beads. When: 11 a.m. to midnight Where: 2310 Manor Road, Cherrywood
